READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 715, 432]]<|/det|> Write your centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 322, 446]]<|/det|> Write in dark blue or black pen. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|> You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 461, 504, 476]]<|/det|> Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 490]]<|/det|> DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 273, 516]]<|/det|> Answer both questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 780, 530]]<|/det|> You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of one hour for each question. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 530, 905, 560]]<|/det|> You are expected to record all your observations as soon as these observations are made, and to plan the presentation of the records so that it is not necessary to make a fair copy of them. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 740, 574]]<|/det|> You are reminded of the need for good English and clear presentation in your answers. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 585, 358, 600]]<|/det|> Electronic calculators may be used. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 599, 767, 615]]<|/det|> You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 624, 806, 640]]<|/det|> Additional answer paper and graph paper should be used only if it becomes necessary to do so. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 604, 666]]<|/det|> At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 665, 759, 680]]<|/det|> The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[680, 720, 905, 848]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 707, 121]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the forces acting on a metre rule.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 134, 146, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[168, 134, 544, 153]]<|/det|>

<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 590, 920, 624]]<|/det|>
The distance between the end of the rule and the loop of string attached to the spring is \(25.0 \text{cm}\). **Keep this distance constant throughout the experiment.**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 636, 920, 670]]<|/det|>
The distance between the end of the rule and the loop of string supporting the mass hanger is \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 682, 915, 700]]<|/det|>
The distance between the end of the rule and the loop of string attached to stand B is \(y\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 713, 645, 732]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 745, 171, 762]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 744, 895, 762]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 775, 920, 809]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 838, 384, 855]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 175, 138]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 120, 918, 155]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 166, 173, 185]]<|/det|>
